page.title: 07 THEARNE
page.content: {Thearne}comes as quite a surprise to the first time visitor. Turning from the main Hull-Beverley road the pace and atmosphere changes immediately. Thearne is a place of peace and quiet with rural charm. The largest building in the village is the hall, although this is of fairly modest proportions. An interesting conversion has been made to the village chapel, now used as a commercial art studio. In former times a ferry operated across the river Hull to the village of {Wawne}but thi closed about fifteen years ago. The surrounding countryside is lightly wooded and used for mixed farming and market gardening.
